revised_title: Rhythmical Impedance Changes in Trout's Eggs
tldr: This study discovered spontaneous rhythmical impedance changes in trout's eggs, which were found to be independent of the apparatus and not an artifact. The changes were observed to be related to the ability of ions to pass through the protoplasmic surface and the dielectric constant of the medium between the cells. The research provides insights into the electrical properties of biological systems and fish reproduction.
